DOCNAME: CASE OF CHMELIR v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings had been pending since DATE against the applicant , who had absconded . On DATE he was arrested by the police and remanded in custody by ORG ( Okresní soud ) .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL March CARDINAL , ORG ( PERSON ) convicted the applicant on several counts , including theft , trespass and illegal possession of weapons , and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . It also imposed a fine and disqualified him from driving for DATE . The judgment also concerned a number of co - defendants , including ORG senior and ORG junior .
CARDINAL . The applicant and the prosecutor lodged appeals before ORG ( Vrchní soud ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE , PERSON , a judge at ORG , was allowed to withdraw from the criminal case ORG and Others on the ground that he was acquainted with ORG 's family .

CARDINAL . Mr Chmelíř 's appeal was subsequently severed from those of his co - defendants . According to the Government , the severance was necessary because of the applicant 's numerous obstruction tactics . The applicant disputed that allegation in his observations , contending that his case had been severed no later than at the second hearing in DATE , the first having taken place at the end of DATE .
CARDINAL . Appeals by the applicant 's co - defendants were dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG division , in which Judge PERSON was sitting , dismissed the applicant 's appeal as ill - founded .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Chmelíř lodged a constitutional appeal against the decisions of the lower courts . He complained in particular of the lack of impartiality of CARDINAL of the High Court judges , observing that CARDINAL of them knew the family of CARDINAL of his co - defendants – and had , on that ground , been ordered to stand down from hearing the appeal lodged by the co - defendants , but not the applicant 's severed appeal – and that the other was the defendant in an action he had brought for the protection of personality rights .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal as manifestly ill - founded , as it had found no indication that the applicant 's guaranteed rights had been violated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released on licence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied for the withdrawal of PERSON , President of the ORG division to which his appeal had been referred , alleging that they had had an intimate relationship in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided at a private sitting not to require PERSON to stand down from the applicant 's case . Noting that PERSON had stated on DATE that he had not been acquainted with the applicant before the criminal case against the latter was referred to him , the court considered that the applicant was simply using dilatory tactics .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Chmelíř appealed against that decision through counsel , contending that ORG had failed to bring together the requisite documents . In his view , even if the objection of bias was lacking in justification , its subject matter was so serious that Judge PERSON should objectively have been excluded from hearing the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's appeal was dismissed by ORG ( PERSON ) as ill - founded .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE given by the President of the ORG division ( ORG ) under LAW , the applicant was fined CARDINAL NORP korunas ( CZK ) ( MONEY ) for contempt of court , on the grounds that he had made false allegations in his application of DATE and that those allegations represented an insolent and unprecedented attack on ORG and were intended to delay the proceedings . The applicant was warned that another similar attack could in the future be classified as a criminal offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's appeal was declared inadmissible by ORG , which considered that the impugned decision had been rendered at second instance .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a fresh application for the withdrawal of PERSON from the case , on the ground that he had brought an action against the judge for the protection of personality rights . He considered that this action in itself cast doubt on PERSON 's impartiality .

CARDINAL . At ORG hearing on DATE , the applicant learnt that his application for the judge 's withdrawal had been rejected at a private sitting of that court on DATE . The division presided over by ORG considered that the applicant 's request simply represented a provocative obstruction and a fresh attack on the judge 's moral integrity . In the decision of DATE , the court stated that , in reaching its finding , it had referred to the content of the application for the judge 's withdrawal , to the statement made by ORG on DATE ( during the proceedings concerning the first application for withdrawal ) and to the applicant 's previous attempts to obstruct the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . Mr Chmelíř appealed against that decision to ORG and also lodged a constitutional appeal in which he relied on his right to a fair hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed that appeal , without examining it on the merits , considering that it was premature .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG declared the applicant 's appeal inadmissible , finding that the impugned decision had been rendered at second instance ( by an appeal court ) and that it was therefore unappealable .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action for the protection of personality rights before the GPE CARDINAL ORG ( Obvodní soud ) against Judge PERSON in his capacity as president of the division to which his appeal had been referred . He alleged that he had suffered non - pecuniary damage because PERSON had obliged him to attend a hearing on DATE even though the judge had been informed of an anonymous threat concerning the presence of explosives on the court LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was requested to submit further particulars of his claims , failing which the proceedings would be discontinued . He complied with the request on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court discontinued the proceedings on the ground that the submissions lacked precision .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) set aside the decision of DATE , finding that cases concerning the protection of personality rights should be heard by the regional courts ( or , in GPE , ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the High Court of Prague settled the dispute as to jurisdiction by referring the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG judge requested the applicant to submit more precise claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's case was dismissed because he had failed to provide sufficient particulars of his claims .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , to which the applicant had appealed , set aside the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and decided that it was necessary to proceed with the examination of that part of the action which concerned redress for non - pecuniary damage ( evaluated by the applicant at CZK MONEY ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected that part of the application . The applicant intended to appeal .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW as applicable at the material time are as follows :

“ No judge , prosecutor , investigator or police representative may act in criminal proceedings if there is any doubt as to their impartiality , whether because they have a connection with the case concerned , with the persons involved therein , or with the lawyers , statutory representatives or agents of such persons , or because they have a connection with another prosecuting authority . No measure taken by a disqualified person may form the basis of any decision arising from the criminal proceedings . ”

“ A decision requiring a judge to stand down for the reasons provided for in LAW shall be taken , even proprio motu , by the authority concerned . With respect to a judge sitting in a particular division , the decision shall be taken by that division . Such decisions shall be appealable and the matter shall be settled by the higher authority . ”

“ Anyone who ignores a warning and continues to obstruct the course of the proceedings , or who behaves in an insulting manner towards the court , the prosecutor , the investigator or the police representative , or who fails to comply with an order or formal notice issued under the present law , may be ordered by the president of the division or , during preparatory proceedings , by the prosecutor , investigator or police representative , to pay a disciplinary fine of CARDINAL NORP korunas . ”
